answer.body:
The subsidy level for the above services will depend on the Household Means-Testing.

topics.title: Shelter and Community Home

questionListItems.title: How to be a Silver Generation Ambassador (SGA)?

answer.body:
What it takes to be a Silver Generation Ambassador:

· Ambassadors have to be 18 years old and above;

· Singapore Citizens or Singapore Permanent Residents;

· Have basic computer literacy skills;

· Able to understand, speak and write simple English sentences;

· Able to understand and speak in Mandarin and/ or dialect


Please click here for more information about Silver Generation Ambassador.

questionListItems.title: What is the training provided to be a Silver Generation Office (SGA)?

answer.body:
Silver Generation Office provides volunteers with…

· Informative training sessions, including role playing to improve engagement skills

· Strong support and guidance

· Various learning and volunteer development opportunities

topics.title: General information on Agency for Integrated Care

answer.body:
Introduction to Anxiety Disorder

Feeling anxious from time to time is nothing unusual, but it becomes an issue if your anxiety is overwhelming you and affecting your daily life. Anxiety disorders take many forms, including Generalised Anxiety Disorder (GAD), Panic Disorder, Phobia and Separation Anxiety Disorder.


For more information on mental health condition​​s, you may refer to the Community Mental Health Resource Directory​.​


Please click here for more information about anxiety disorder.

questionListItems.title: How is anxiety disorder being treated?

answer.body:
How it is treated 

If you think you or someone you know may have anxiety disorder, you should seek advice from a mental health professional. Treatment comes in two main forms: Psychological treatments: Involves using therapeutic techniques which can help manage the anxiety. Medication: There is evidence to suggest that people with an anxiety disorder may have chemical imbalances in their brain. Medications can restore balance.


Please click here for more information about anxiety disorder.

topics.title: General information on Agency for Integrated Care
Medical Conditions

parentTopic.title: General information on Agency for Integrated Care

answer.body:
Importance of mental wellness

Most people know that it is important to keep their physical body healthy, but few remember to do the same for their mind and emotions. Here are some tips to give your mind a break:

Set aside some time (e.g. five-10mins) for quiet time where you won't be interrupted by calls, e-mails or other people

Think of a time or place that puts you into a state of peace. Use all your senses to relive the experience. Imagine the aroma of the coffee and toast for breakfast in bed on Sundays, or the soothing music you listen to every night.

Listen to relaxing music instead of a news radio, or loud music like rap or rock.


For more information on mental health conditions, you may refer to the Community Mental Health Resource Directory.


Please click here for more information about mental wellness.

Medical Conditions

answer.body:
Introduction to depression

It is normal to feel sad at some point in our lives, but this may be a problem if you have been feeling low for a long time and it has affected your daily life.

Feeling sad for at least two weeks is often called clinical depression. It is a mental health condition and not a “weakness”. Most of all, it cannot be willed away.


For more information on mental health conditions, you may refer to the Community Mental Health Resource Directory.


Please click here for more information about depression.

questionListItems.title: What are the signs and symptoms of depression?

answer.body:
Thoughts of suicide/death

· Change of sleeping patterns

· Loss of appetite/weight changes

· Loss of energy

· Feeling hopeless, sad or empty

· Irritability and outbursts of anger

· Tiredness

· Displeasure in socialising

· Lack of interest in activities that were once pleasurable

· Slowed body movements, thinking and speech


Please click here for more information about depression.

topics.title: General information on Agency for Integrated Care
Medical Conditions

parentTopic.title: General information on Agency for Integrated Care

answer.body:
How it is treated 

If you think you or someone you know may have depression, consult a mental health professional.

Treatment comes in the following forms:

Psychological therapy: This can help you to cope with stress and low mood.

Medication: Anti-depressants helps regulate your brain's chemical balance, improving the symptoms of depression. 

Treatment can also be a combination of the two, which can boost chances of recovery.


Please click here for more information about depression.
